means: 普林尼（姓氏； Pliny “the Elder”， Gaius Plinius Secundus 老普林尼， 23-79，罗马学者）

sentence.Network_en: Home is where the heart is. - ---- Pliny.
sentence.Network_cn: 家者,心之所系也. ---- 普里尼.

sentence.Network_en: A mixture of Socrates, Pericles, Mahomet, Pliny the Younger and Augustin Thierry.
sentence.Network_cn: 以下这些人都喜欢:苏格拉底, 伯里克利, 穆罕默德, 小普林尼和奥古斯汀西耶里.

sentence.Network_en: Pliny recommended it as an antidote to poison.
sentence.Network_cn: 普林尼推荐它,作为一种解毒剂.

means.word_mean: 1. Roman writer and nephew of Pliny the Elder; author of books of letters that commented on affairs of the day (62-113)
2. Roman author of an encylclopedic natural history; died while observing the eruption of Vesuvius (23-79)
